title: Trump: Some Americans may 'like a dictator'
shortDescription: President Donald Trump said some Americans may "like a dictator‚Äù while defending his stance on violence in Chicago.

title: 'Purge or revolution?' Trump presses South Korea on martial law probe
shortDescription: Trump said he was concerned by "very vicious raids on churches by the new government in South Korea."

title: Is flag burning protected speech? What to know about Trump's order
shortDescription: The Supreme Court upheld the right of protesters to burn the American flag in a landmark 1989 case. President Trump is testing that in a new order.

title: Trump moves to end cashless bail
shortDescription: President Trump signs two executive orders surrounding cashless bail policies. Here's what cashless bail means.

title: 'I'm not a dictator': Trump defends deploying military in crime crackdown
shortDescription: As Democrats push back on a military crackdown on crime in U.S. cities, Trump defended the move and said it is not about authoritarianism.

title: Trump says he will attend Ryder Cup, the latest of many sports events
shortDescription: Donald Trump announced he will attend the Ryder Cup in New York, a biennial golf tournament. He has also attended the Super Bowl and UFC fights.

title: The end of bail reform? Trump orders cash bond for anyone who's arrested
shortDescription: Trump signed two orders that aim to require criminal suspects to post cash bail to get released from jail before trial.

title: Trump wants a year in prison for flag burners. Is that legal?
shortDescription: Trump seeks to charge people who burn flags that incite violent crime, which he argued wouldn't be protected as political speech.

title: France summons Ivanka Trump's father-in-law in antisemitism spat
shortDescription: U.S. Ambassador to France Charles Kushner wrote an open letter asking French President Emmanuel Macron to tone down his criticism of Israel.

title: Is Trump ending Section 8? Not yet, but he suggested these changes
shortDescription: President Donald Trump's FY2026 budget included some drastic changes to HUD's rental assistance program known as Section 8. Is it ending under the bill?

title: 'Keep our name out of your mouth:' Gov. Moore to President Trump
shortDescription: Maryland Governor, Wes Moore, said "Keep our name out of your mouth", referring to President Trump's recent critical remarks about Baltimore.

title: Trump threatens Chris Christie with new 'Bridgegate' investigation
shortDescription: President Donald Trump threatened to open an investigation targeting Chris Christie over "Bridgegate" after Christie criticized Trump on television.

title: Chris Christie says Ghislaine Maxwell's praise of Trump is phony
shortDescription: 'We're going to believe Ghislaine Maxwell?' the former New Jersey governor, a vocal Trump critic, told ABC News on Aug. 24.

title: Trump says he could 'rethink' funds for Baltimore bridge repair
shortDescription: President Donald Trump lashed out at Gov. Wes Moore after the Maryland Democrat criticized his efforts in Washington.

title: New poll shows more Americans 'strongly disapprove' of Trump's second term
shortDescription: In a poll from YouGov/The Economist, two-thirds say they have strong feelings about Donald Trump - either positive or negative. Here's the breakdown.

title: Trump sends warm letter to Zelenskyy as he presses for Putin meeting
shortDescription: 'The United States supports a negotiated settlement' with Russia, President Donald Trump added in a warm letter to the Ukrainian leader.

title: Frustrated voters caught in redistricting war: 'This is strictly politics'
shortDescription: As Texas approves new congressional maps, California is fighting back. Caught in the middle are frustrated voters.

title: Texas Senate approves redistricting bill
shortDescription: The Texas Senate approved the GOP-favored voting map that could flip five seats in the 2026 midterm elections.

title: Trump admin. wants to send Kilmar Abrego Garcia to Uganda: Filings
shortDescription: His lawyers say he's being coerced into pleading guilty in a criminal case in order to not be sent to the African country.

title: Can Trump and the GOP beat the midterm odds - and history - in 2026?
shortDescription: Trump is pushing the envelope of typical campaign maneuvering with things like redistricting, and the party is jumping at his orders.

title: He won over Charlamagne tha God. Now Gavin Newsom is coming for Trump
shortDescription: California's governor is raking in cash and skyrocketing to the top of the polls for his eye-for-an-eye approach as he imitates Trump's online rants.
